intro: Alpinia acrostachya, commonly known as the red ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and related plants. The plant features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, adorned with lance-shaped, dark green leaves. Its flowers are bright red or orange and are clustered in inflorescences at the top of the plant. Alpinia acrostachya is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
